instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00239: What is 820-00239? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No SSD
threads.message: Hello!, got this touchbar board <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> which has question mark. Board had no signs of liquid damage, P2V7NAND was not present so inspected J9600 and one of the pins seemed to be damaged, replaced connector, P2V7NAND came up, thought sorted, but after couple of seconds smoke came up from <CHIP>U9400</CHIP>, replaced <CHIP>U9400</CHIP>, but now P2V7NAND on <CAPACITOR>C9421</CAPACITOR> not present again, but measuring <CAPACITOR>C9402</CAPACITOR> i get 13V which is ppbus power rail. Which components should i inspect to find short? i suppose it is one of the lines from <CHIP>U9400</CHIP>? Thank you in advance! :)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No SSD
threads.message:
I bet <RESISTOR>R9406</RESISTOR> is burnt.
Check first if <SIGNAL>PP5V_S4_P2V7NAND_LB</SIGNAL> is present.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00239</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> No SSD
threads.message: BINGO!, issue was exactly with <RESISTOR>R9406</RESISTOR>, Thank you for quick solution 2informaticos!
